Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats, one on land and one in water.
The student can include a variety of living things in each habitat, such as trees and grasses for land, and fish and clams for water.
The student can show different plants in the land habitat, like bushes and flowering plants.
The student can illustrate different animals in the land habitat, such as lizards or squirrels.
The student can depict different living things in the water habitat, such as fish and aquatic plants.
The student can compare the living things in the two habitats by showing differences in the types of plants and animals.
The student can illustrate patterns in biodiversity by showing groups of similar or different plants and animals in each habitat.
